summary: Replaces all atronachs with the NPC + Outfit you like.
descriptionHtml:
Hello everyone, after learning how to write SkyProc patchers I've finally decided to upload my first patcher.

What this mod does:
It allows you to replace all atronachs' appearances with the NPC and outfit you specify. The appearances of Fire, Frost and Storm Atronachs are independent from each other.

Requirements:
Java 1.8 or newer. You can download it [url=https://www.java.com/de/download/]->here[/url].
If you hate Java for trying to download toolbars, adware, not asking for an install directory, etc you really should check out, bookmark and download via this page [url=http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/index.html]->here[/url]. Seriously, this is the better download source!

Installation:
Download and install via NMM, or download the zip file and drop it's contents into your Skyrim/Data folder.
Run the patcher that is located at Skyrim/Data/SkyProc Patchers/AtronachReplacer/Atronach Patcher.jar

How to use the patcher:
[list=1]
[*]This is important: Wait until the patcher has imported all your mods. If you don't wait there's a possibility that the NPC or outfit you want don't show up in the patcher.
[*]Open the configuration page for any of the atronachs.
[*]Choose the NPC that your atronachs shall look like.
[*]Choose the outfit your atronachs shall wear. If you choose multiple outfits the atronach will randomly choose one every time it is summoned.
[*]Repeat Steps 3 and 4 for the other atronachs.
[*]Click Patch to create your patch.
[*]Activate the AtronachReplacer Patch.esp in your load order.
[/list]
But... why?
I was inspired to create such a replacer when I first saw loshirai14's Temptress of Flame and Temptress of Ice outfits. Considering that the Flame Atronach already looks female I decided to create a replacer (and even got loshirai14's permission at that time) only to run into compatibility issues with other mods and the problem that I'd have to dictate the NPC that serves as a template. I didn't like that, so I put the project on ice. When I recently learned how to write patchers I realised, that a patcher can solve all these problems and picked the project up again.
